meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes a swishing sound.
meanings.sent1: The swasher of the broom could be heard as she cleaned the floor.
meanings.sent2: The leaves rustled in the wind, creating a swasher in the trees.
meanings.sent3: The swasher of the river as it flowed downstream was like nature's own music.
meanings.sent4: The swasher of the wind through the leaves whispered secrets to the forest.
meanings.sent5: The swasher of the waves against the shore was calming to listen to.

meanings.definition: A washer or ring used to secure a bolt or screw.
meanings.sent1: He used a swasher to tighten the bolt securely in place.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic grabbed a swasher to fix the loose screw in the engine.
meanings.sent3: The shiny swasher slipped from his fingers and rolled under the table.
meanings.sent4: The swasher acted like a protective shield around the bolt, keeping it in position.
meanings.sent5: She carefully placed the swasher under the nut to keep it from coming loose.

meanings.definition: A person who boasts or brags loudly.
meanings.sent1: The swasher at the party wouldn't stop talking about his achievements.
meanings.sent2: She rolled her eyes at the swasher who claimed to have done it all.
meanings.sent3: The swasher's stories were so exaggerated that they became comical.
meanings.sent4: His role as the swasher in the group made him the center of attention.
meanings.sent5: The swasher's loud bragging was like a never-ending performance for the listeners.
